result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roberto Perez

defendant.name: Perez, Roberto
defendant.address: 571 County Road A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941

records.addlTxt: Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin via zoom video.

3:49 p.m. Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Michael Kapelis.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin via video.  Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to count 1 and count 2 in 2016CT10 with jail, fine and costs and 2016CM74 will be dismissed and read-in. DA concurs. Atty Kapelis concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on both counts 1 & 2 as charged in 2016CT10 and orders 2016CM74 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by DA. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 1 & Count 2 (Each) 

-34 days county jail, concurrent to each other. Court grants the defendant 34 days of sentence credit.
Count 1 - Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.
Count 2 - $150 fine plus costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.

Court adjourned at 3:57 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 3, 2020 at 03:45 pm.
Status hearing on November 10, 2020 at 02:00 pm.
Atty Michael Kapelis via zoom. DA Andrew Christenson via zoom.

11:46 a.m. Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Michael Kapelis via zoom.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin via zoom.  Statement by Atty Kapelis - was recently appointed on the cases, has not discussed Discovery with defendant and requests another status hearing. Statement by Atty Kapelis regarding requests for bond reduction. Court goes over cases and warrants that were issued. Statement by DA Christenson. Court denies the request for bond modification. Court sets for Status Hearing on November 10, 2020 at 2:00 p,m.  

Court adjourned at 11:50 a.m.
to Modify Bond (Defendant's)
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**

Defendant in custody and via zoom. Atty Michael Kapelis via telephone. DA Andrew Christenson via video.

1:10 p.m. Defendant in custody and present in court via video with Atty Michael Kapelis via telephone.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin via video. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via video. 2016CT10- Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Kapelis enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation. BOTH Cases - Court sets bond at $500.00 cash bond. Court will set for Status Hearing on October 19, 2020 at 11:45 a.m.. Court quashes the warrants on both cases.

Court adjourned at 1:14 p.m.
